column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Two further Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.  The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 405 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Sunday
column5: 482 on Saturday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.The Department of Health's Covid-19 dashboard is not updated over the weekend.On Friday there were 370 Covid inpatients in hospitals across Northern Ireland.Thirty-three people were being treated intensive care units (ICU).Last updated 28 November at 14:05 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column8: 203 vaccines for Covid-19 had been administered in Northern Ireland as of Friday.1
column10: 366 of the jabs were first doses
column14: 248 were third doses of the vaccine. The remainder were booster jabs. Last updated 26 November at 14:25 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandAnother 3
column15: 735 cases of coronavirus were reported in the Republic of Ireland on Sunday
column17: 791 on Saturday.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
column20: is updated weekly and includes "probable and possible" Covid-19-linked deaths.There are 566 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals
column21: up from 536 Saturday.117 patients with Covid-19 are in intensive care units (ICU).Last updated 28 November at 12:30  local timeSource: Department of Health IrelandA total of 7
